newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish NFI 11 1996 loss worsens to PLN 30.8 mln.
newsitem.headline: Polish NFI 11 1996 loss worsens to PLN 30.8 mln.

text.p: The net loss of National Investment Fund (NFI) No. 11 in Poland's mass privatisation scheme worsened to 30.8 million zlotys last year from 1.2 million in 1995, the fund said in an issue prospectus.
The fund said its total assets should rise to about 532 million zlotys in 1999 and 1.2 billion zlotys in 2005 from 403.4 million zlotys last year.
Under the government's NFI programme, shares in about 500 mid-sized companies are allocated to 15 NFIs run by foreign and domestic management firms.

From May 12 the 26 million Poles who bought a participation unit in the scheme will have the opportunity to exchange it for 15 shares, one in each fund, which are expected to start trade on the Warsaw bourse around mid-year.
Each NFI has 31,026,185 shares. The units lose their validity on December 31, 1998.
